intro: Tragia miqueliana var. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored tragia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its striking bi-colored flowers, which typically display a mix of red and yellow hues. It grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its structure includes hairy stems and alternate leaves, with small, showy flowers that attract pollinators.
